intro: Astragalus pseudophysodes, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a deep taproot system that allows it to access water from deeper soil layers. Astragalus pseudophysodes plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife in its native range.
